PrimEcoSys: Southern California Coast Ranges Cliff and Canyon

habitat_description:
This species is restricted to the southwestern region of California and north-central Baja California (Grismer 2002; Stebbins 2003). Stebbins (2003) reported an elevational range of approximately 120-2320 meters.

The habitat includes foothills, rocky canyons, and hillsides of arid to semiarid areas. More specifically, this lizard is found in chaparral, pinyon-juniper woodland, and shrubland. Also found in the shadier areas of canyons among exfoliating granitic outcrops and near water (Grismer 2002; Stebbins 2003).

Found in association with chaparral, pinyon-juniper woodland, and shrubland.
